class_notes:
One-credit course the first six-weeks of the semester.
Request permission: https://forms.gle/rihHtCbw9LpJhGAZ7


This course explores beginning metal fabrication and welding techniques used in theater construction. Topics will include: Safety, cutting and processing metals, basic metal fabrication techniques, GMAW (MIG) welding, SMAW (Arc) welding, OAW (Torch) welding, Plasma cutting, and sculpting metal through heating and bending. The course will include hands-on demonstrations along with assigned projects that will explore fabrication and welding processes. Students must be familiar with using personal protective equipment, shop safety, and familiar with the use of basic shop tools.


Course Fee: $80
course_description: Individual courses on special topics in theater at the 200-level. This course may be repeated.
